Json Manager¶

class json_justify.jason.JsonManager(data, allow_extra=False, _child_hook=False)¶

This is the main json field which ultimately any progarm will subclass to make it possible to create Json classes

Attributes:
data (TYPE): Description otk_token (TYPE): Description
Object¶

alias of builtins.dict

add_render_machiene(func)¶

The function which will run

Args:
func (callable): A callable
generate_otk_token()¶

This method should be reimplemented in the class who will instanciate this

Returns:
tuple: authentication token
integral_types(data)¶

This is used to check if field data is in integral types or not

Args:
fields (any): any field data
is_object(value)¶

This class is used to check if it is dir which is standard key value pair or not

Args:
value (any): Value to validate
Returns:
bool: True if dir else Flase
is_valid()¶

This is the manage function which will run Field’s validate function in for loop

items()¶

This is the implementation of items

Returns:
list: a tuple to access
json_or_error()¶

json_or_error function should be to get json or error -json and returned to system and then rendered accordingly :return:

regester_attris(func)¶

This function is used to register own functions which will run in creation of dictionary

Args:
func (func): The function to run when class attributes one want to register
regester_error(name, value)¶

This is used to regester error to the object and used to regester validation Error

Args:
error_obj (TYPE): Description
render_json()¶

This function is used as a master key to create json with registered rendered function and send it back as response

setup_fields()¶

This function will setup or say filter fields form all value in object

Returns:
dict: dict of filtered obj
setup_json()¶

This is function which will be used to setup form if data is not provided in json format
